segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes like nothing else matters in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water pouring over the sink, soaking her shoes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she just keeps polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just ignoring it or really doesn’t see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies right behind her, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool looks like it’s about to tip, and she’s completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window is open, and the garden outside looks so peaceful, but in here, it’s chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to regret not paying attention when someone slips on that wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still running, and she’s just standing there like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
